data.question: What is the synthesis temperature for compound 1?
What method was used for the synthesis of compound 1?
Is the framework of compound 1 flexible?
What is the role of the centered N atom in the ligand H4BCBAIP?
data.answer: It plays a crucial role in the conformation and can be considered as an organic tetrahedral node.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of compound 1?
Does compound 1 exhibit dye-adsorption properties?
What is the crystal system of compound 1?
Can compound 1 be used for light-harvesting applications?
What is the main difference between H4BCBAIP and H4BCBAIP' ligands?
data.answer: The position of the carboxylate acid group in the carboxybenzyl group.

data.question: What is the CO2 uptake of compound 1 at 273 K and 722 mmHg?
Is the sodalite cage in compound 1 nano-sized?
What is the space group of compound 1?
Does the synthesis of compound 1 involve the use of DEF and C2H5OH?
What is the role of In3+ ions in the structure of compound 1?
data.answer: They coordinate to four carboxylate groups to form a tetrahedral four-connected {In(O2C)4} group.

data.question: What is the crystallographic R1 value for compound 1?
Is the adsorption behavior of compound 1 towards different dyes uniform?
What synthetic strategy was employed for the construction of compound 1?
What is the unit cell volume of compound 1?
Does compound 1 have an anionic framework?
What is the significance of the T–L–T angles in the construction of compound 1?
data.answer: The suitable T–L–T angles are key for the construction of compound 1, mimicking the T–O–T angles in zeolite structures.
